nl.renarj.jasdb.index

Interface Index

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BTreeIndex

    public interface Index
extends AutoCloseable
    This is the index interface, any Index implementation will require this interface to be implemented. Any index will support search, insert, update and remove operations on the index. The index will work on a given Key object which can be used for any operation on the index. Any index supplies a KeyInfo object which can be used to determine information about the Index.
    Author:
    Renze de Vries

      • match

        int match(Set<String> fields)
        Determines how close the gives fields match the index descriptor. The scale is on 0-200. This would reach 200 in case all value fields and index fields are a 100% match. The calculation is N (number of matching fields) / field.size + (N / fields.size) * included matching columns.
        Parameters:
        fields - The fields being requested
        Returns:
        The match ratio from 0-200

      • searchIndex

        IndexSearchResultIteratorCollection searchIndex(SearchCondition searchCondition,
                                                SearchLimit searchLimit)
                                         throws JasDBStorageException
        Do a search operation of the index given the searchcondition. The searchCondition is based on a specific search in this index and only applies to the given index. The searchlimit determines the maximum results to be retrieved.
        Parameters:
        searchCondition - The searchcondition to apply to only this index
        searchLimit - The searchlimit to apply whilst searching
        Returns:
        An iterator that will be able to iterate over results and is mergable
        Throws:
        JasDBStorageException - If unable to complete the search in the index

      • getIndexIterator

        IndexIterator getIndexIterator()
                        throws JasDBStorageException
        This gets an iterator which allows iterating over the full index collection
        Returns:
        The index iterator
        Throws:
        JasDBStorageException - If unable to open the index iterator

      • insertIntoIndex

        void insertIntoIndex(Key key)
              throws JasDBStorageException
        Inserts the given key into the index, the key is to expected to conform to the index key specification as determined in the keyinfo.
        Parameters:
        key - The key to be persisted to the index
        Throws:
        JasDBStorageException - If unable to persist the key in the index

      • removeFromIndex

        void removeFromIndex(Key key)
              throws JasDBStorageException
        Remove the given key and its values from the index. The key only requires the key part to be populated, value fields are not required to be populated.
        Parameters:
        key - The key to be removed from the index
        Throws:
        JasDBStorageException - If unable to remove the key from the index

      • updateKey

        void updateKey(Key oldKey,
               Key newKey)
        throws JasDBStorageException
        Update the key payload inside the index, the key is to expected to conform to the index key specification as determined in the keyinfo.
        Parameters:
        oldKey - The previous key present in the index
        newKey - The new key value to be used instead
        Throws:
        JasDBStorageException - If unable to update the key in the index

          throws JasDBStorageException

      • flushIndex

        void flushIndex()
         throws JasDBStorageException
        This persists the changes to the disk backing of the index
        Throws:
        JasDBStorageException - If unable to flush the changes

      • scan

        IndexScanReport scan(ScanIntent intent,
                     Iterator<IndexableItem> scanItems)
              throws JasDBStorageException
        This performs a scan of the index and reports on the integrity. The scan is done with an intent indicating a rescan is requested or just a report. In case of a report it returns the last scan result if present, if not present scan will be performed and returned. The scan operation will modify the index state according to scan report, if scan reveals invalid index it will set state to invalid, etc.
        Parameters:
        intent - The scanning intent, rescan or report
        scanItems - The list of items to scan for in the index
        Returns:
        The scan report indicating index state
        Throws:
        JasDBStorageException - If unable to perform or complete index scan

      • getState

        IndexState getState()
        Returns the state of the index
        Returns:
        The state of index

      • rebuildIndex

        void rebuildIndex(Iterator<IndexableItem> indexableItems)
           throws JasDBStorageException
        Do a full rebuild of the index and fully populate it based on provided item iterator
        Parameters:
        indexableItems - The items to be indexed
        Throws:
        JasDBStorageException - If unable to rebuild the index

      • getMemoryManager

        MemoryAware getMemoryManager()
                      throws JasDBStorageException
        This is the memory manager of the index, this is used to determine vital memory parameters.
        Returns:
        THe memory manager used by this index
        Throws:
        JasDBStorageException
